title: It's Alabama vs. Georgia for the National Title After a Pair of Blowouts
summary: The Crimson Tide defeated Cincinnati 27-6 to return to the title game, where they'll face a Bulldogs team that beat Michigan 34-11. MIAMI GARDENS, Fla.-Georgia played football with all the subtlety of a wrecking ball throughout the 2021 season-with the exception of one Saturday in December, when Alabama matter-of-factly shut down the Bulldogs' destructive ways and ruined their perfect season.

title: Gold Notches Largest Percentage Decline Since 2015
summary: Investors expect rising interest rates and a climbing U.S. dollar to pressure the metal. Inflation shot higher in 2021. Gold didn't.

title: Crypto Burrows Into the Mainstream
summary: It was another crazy year in the crypto world, but traders didn't seem to mind. Millions of new investors decided to try their hand at cryptocurrencies in 2021.. Crypto has been many things in its short history. 2021 was the year it became part of the mainstream.

title: New Year's Eve Is Muted Once Again by Covid-19
summary: Public health experts urge caution as people gather to ring in 2022. After the somber welcome that greeted 2021, many people saw this year's holiday season as a time to revel in a return to near-normal. But New Year's Eve celebrations around the world have once again been canceled or scaled back amid a new wave of Covid-19 infections driven by the Omicron variant.

title: Beijing Fell Short on Trade Deal Promises, Creating Dilemma for Biden
summary: China missed targets for buying U.S. goods, but retaliating could come at a cost to American companies and consumers. WASHINGTON-Beijing's commitment to step up purchases of U.S. goods and services under a 2020 trade pact expires Friday with China expected to miss its targets by a wide margin, creating a dilemma for the Biden administration as it calibrates a response.

title: Ringing in 2022 Around the Globe
summary: People ushered in the new year with fireworks and festivities all over the world. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Why Student Debt Keeps Growing-Even When Borrowers Keep Paying
summary: Some loan payment plans aren't enough to cover interest, and a punishing tax bill can await years down the line. How does a graduate student loan balance get out of control, despite years of dutiful payments?

title: Solar to Start Year With Some Long Shadows
summary: Rooftop solar companies face gloomier outlook, with some sunny states considering overhauls to subsidies. Rooftop solar companies aren't exactly starting out the new year with the sun shining on their faces.

title: Chief Justice Roberts Pledges to Bolster Judicial Ethics
summary: Year-end report addresses Wall Street Journal findings that federal judges with financial conflicts improperly ruled in hundreds of cases. WASHINGTON-Chief Justice John Roberts pledged Friday to improve ethics training and bolster internal compliance systems for the federal judiciary, citing a Wall Street Journal investigation that found hundreds of instances where judges presided over cases involving companies in which they or their relatives held stock.

title: 'Golden Girl' Betty White Dies at Age 99
summary: One of the first female producers and talk-show hosts in the nascent television medium, she went on to beloved sitcom roles and numerous guest appearances over the decades. Betty White, the television actor who projected wholesomeness laced with knowing wit and sharp comedic timing, in "The Mary Tyler Moore Show" and "The Golden Girls" and later as the doyenne of show business, has died at 99 years old.

title: Stocks Edge Lower in Year's Last Session
summary: S&P 500 closed at records 70 times this year, more than one-quarter of all trading days. U.S. stocks ticked lower on the last trading day of 2021, wrapping up a year of repeated records on Wall Street on low interest rates and the rollout of Covid-19 vaccines.

title: Who Won in Afghanistan? Private Contractors
summary: Resume Subscription. The U.S. lost its 20-year campaign to transform Afghanistan. Many contractors won big.

title: In a Wild Year for Markets, Stocks Still Achieve Big Gains
summary: Shares soared throughout the year, but their ascent has been anything but calm. U.S. stocks saw a third consecutive year of big gains, with major indexes closing 2021 near record highs.

title: Omicron Blurs Oil Outlook After Demand Roars Back
summary: Traders grapple with fast-spreading coronavirus variant, long-run consumption questions. The fast-spreading Omicron variant is clouding the outlook for oil markets after a rapid recovery in demand pushed prices to their highest levels in years.

title: FDIC Chairman Jelena McWilliams Resigns
summary: Resignation follows public fight with Democratic board members over control of FDIC board. Federal Deposit Insurance Corp. Chairman Jelena McWilliams resigned on Friday, the agency said.

title: Betty White's Seven Decades on TV, From Happy Homemaker to 'SNL' Host
summary: After a career spanning talk shows, game shows and landmark sitcoms, White rode the admiration of younger stars to a late-career surge. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: South Africa Says Its Omicron Wave Is in Retreat
summary: New U.K. data bolsters evidence that the variant is less likely to cause severe disease than earlier versions of the virus. The South African government said a wave of Covid-19 caused by the Omicron variant is retreating, while new U.K. data bolstered evidence that it is less likely to cause severe disease than earlier versions of the virus.

title: How This Pandemic Has Left Us Less Prepared for the Next One
summary: Resume Subscription. Tiny vials of bat saliva in a laboratory in Wuhan, China, collected with help from U.S. government funding, potentially hold clues to the origin of Covid-19 or the next pandemic.

title: Colorado Fire Destroyed at Least 500 Homes, Including Entire Subdivisions
summary: Officials are just beginning to assess the damage to Superior and Louisville; no deaths have been reported. At least 500 homes in two Colorado towns were destroyed and many more damaged as a wildfire fueled by strong winds spread quickly through heavily populated areas. But, in what officials called a miracle, no deaths have been reported.

title: Cadiz, Biden and Californians' Right to Water
summary: Federal efforts obstruct a desperately needed water project.. I write to offer our vociferous support of your position in "Biden's California Water Embargo" (Review & Outlook, Dec. 17), crying foul about federal efforts to obstruct a desperately needed water project. Readers should know how politics can threaten our human right to water.

title: The Superfluous Term: Don't Call Us 'Latinx'
summary: There is already a perfectly appropriate English word.. Charlotte Allen's op-ed "'Latinx' Isn't Popular With Latinos" (Dec. 20) is right on the mark. In Spanish, anything pertaining to Latin culture or background is described as either "latino" or "latina," uncapitalized. The gender distinction is a basic characteristic of romance languages, used not only to distinguish male or female, but also objects or concepts that by convention are assigned a gender: "musica latina" (Latin music) or "sabor latino" (Latin flavor).

title: Teva Found Liable for Fueling Opioid Addiction in New York
summary: The Israeli pharmaceutical company says it will appeal. A jury in New York state found drugmaker Teva Pharmaceuticals USA Inc. liable for creating a public nuisance in the state and two Long Island counties amid the national opioid epidemic.

title: Will Covid-19 Become an Endemic Disease?
summary: The disease that caused the global pandemic will likely circulate for the foreseeable future, public-health experts say. Many public-health experts anticipate that the world will be dealing with Covid-19 for the foreseeable future. That doesn't mean the pandemic won't end.

title: China Warns Walmart Against Removing Items Made in Xinjiang
summary: Country says retailer could face consequences for boycotting items from the region where the U.S. has human-rights concerns. China's anti-corruption watchdog criticized Walmart Inc. on Friday, warning of a consumer boycott following reports that the world's largest retailer had stopped stocking products from Xinjiang in its China-based Walmart and Sam's Club stores.

title: 3G Capital Diversifies Away From Food With Hunter Douglas Deal
summary: Private-equity firm set to take control of the Dutch window-coverings maker, in its first deal since 2015. 3G Capital has agreed to buy a majority stake in Dutch window-coverings maker Hunter Douglas NV in a transaction that values the business at about $6.9 billion, expanding beyond its food-and-beverage focus for its first big deal since 2015.

title: Modest New Year's Resolutions for 2022
summary: People like to start Jan. 1 with big promises. What about something more humble?. New Year's Eve is approaching, and you know what that means: people making lofty public resolutions they have no intention of keeping past Jan. 3.

title: Bulgari Offers $39,000 Hotel Suite for Potential Buyers of Its Jewels
summary: In-room jewelry viewings and sneak peeks of new collections are perks of staying at the jeweler's growing list of hotel properties. PARIS-Who would pay more than $39,000 a night for a hotel suite?

title: New State Laws Address Taxes, Housing Deregulation, Other Issues
summary: Pork production, the cost of dating apps and foam takeout containers are also the focus of laws taking effect in the new year. Hundreds of state laws across the country are set to take effect in January, dealing with issues including housing deregulation, foam containers and the cost of dating apps.

title: Tesla and My Other Investing Mistakes of 2021
summary: A look back at lessons learned from a year of Streetwise columns on Tesla, meme stocks and inflation. Streetwise started the year with a prescient forecast: There is plenty of scope to be horribly wrong about predictions of speculative excess. As 2021 draws to a close, it is a good time for investors to look back at the decisions they made over the year, and why they made them, with the hope of learning from their mistakes. My mistakes are preserved for posterity in public columns, but investors should keep a diary of why they entered each trade, to avoid the human tendency to rationalize with hindsight.

title: Eight Artists Fans Hope Will Release Long-Awaited Albums in 2022
summary: A look at some of pop music's most longed-for albums across hip-hop, pop and rock 'n' roll. Will your favorite pop-music star finally release that long-awaited album? That's a big question for fans of everyone from Rihanna to the Rolling Stones.

title: CIOs Sound Off on Tech Buzzwords That Need to Go
summary: Among the most overused tech terms of 2021: 'agile,' 'digital transformation,' 'AI' and the cringe-y 'innovation'. Some are just hackneyed. Others signal something, but mean nothing specific. Others nod to a shiny virtual future, which they may or may not deliver. Some are just irritating.

title: Chinese Small Businesses' No Good, Very Bad Year
summary: By some indicators, 2021 is shaping up to be the worst year for China's small entrepreneurs in a long, long time. U.S. small-business owners are dealing with high inflation and scarce workers. China's small businesspeople are facing a different, but no less worrying set of challenges. By some indicators, 2021 is shaping up to have been the worst year for China's small entrepreneurs in a long, long time.

title: Fed Rate-Setting Panel Gets New Members Amid Rate Expectations
summary: Annual rotation of committee members means the chiefs of the Kansas City, St. Louis, Cleveland and Boston banks will join. Federal Reserve regional bank presidents who gain votes in the new year on the central bank's interest-rate-setting committee are likely to strongly support raising borrowing costs to try to combat high inflation.

title: China Evergrande Revises Wealth-Management Payment Plan
summary: Unit proposes paying almost all product holders $1,255 a month from December to February. China Evergrande Group said it has come up with a new repayment plan for disgruntled individual investors who purchased its wealth-management products, as the beleaguered property giant takes further steps to work through a mountain of financial liabilities and overdue payments.

title: Peloton Went From Pandemic Winner to HBO Punchline
summary: Management miscalculations and reversals compounded challenges caused by Covid-19. A dust-up over the reboot of HBO's "Sex and the City" capped a tumultuous year for Peloton Interactive Inc., which saw its market value tumble as the company's leaders struggled to gauge demand for its web-connected bikes.

title: Omicron Pushes Urgent Care Centers to the Brink
summary: Clinics across the U.S. are temporarily closing as the Covid-19 variant hits employees and testing demand surges. Urgent care centers across the U.S. are grappling with what to do as the fast-spreading Omicron variant hits employees and the demand for Covid-19 testing surges. In some instances, they are closing certain locations for a few days.

title: How Chelsea Became the Most 2021 Club in English Soccer
summary: From the European Super League to shopping in the pandemic, the Blues seemingly put themselves front and center of every major narrative this year. There have been short, mad spells like this one before at Chelsea. A coaching change, a Champions League final, some lavish spending in the transfer market-these are somehow not rare occurrences at one of the most dramatic clubs in international soccer.

title: Inside Antwerp, Europe's Cocaine Gateway
summary: Resume Subscription. ANTWERP, Belgium-For centuries, goods flowing through the giant port here have enriched this elegant city, known for its diamonds, art and fashion.

title: Training Programs Spring Up in Board-Diversity Drive
summary: Law firms, universities, existing board members offer classes to prepare and broaden the pool of candidates. U.S. companies are turning to programs aimed at preparing women and people of color for corporate board roles in a bid to comply with calls from regulators and investors to diversify their directors.

title: IKEA to Raise Prices as Global Supply Costs Keep Rising
summary: Furniture giant says transport and raw materials are getting more expensive. IKEA said it would increase the prices of its products around the world as the furniture giant grapples with rising transport and raw-materials costs.

title: Apple Stays on Top for Phone Sales in China
summary: Company had a 23.6% market share in November, according to market researcher. Apple Inc. secured the top spot for phone sales in China for a second straight month in November, according to market research data, driven by the success of the iPhone 13 series.

title: Hong Kong Tech Stocks Surge on Last Day of 2021
summary: Chinese internet stocks led the rally, with Alibaba, Baidu and Bilibili logging gains. Shares of Chinese internet and technology companies jumped in Hong Kong on the last day of the year, following a surge in their corresponding American depositary receipts overnight.

title: U.S. Restrictions Push Huawei's Revenue Down by Nearly a Third
summary: Chinese technology company says efforts to reshape its business remain on track. HONG KONG-Huawei Technologies Co. said revenue dropped by nearly a third in 2021, as the effects of U.S. export restrictions hammered the Chinese tech giant's main business lines.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.
